fabric.title: COVER
fabric.caption: Until shortly after humans arrived on the island around 2,000 years ago, there were lemurs as large as a male gorilla.

fabric.title: SCENE 1: SELFIES
fabric.caption: Lemurs are a clade of strepsirrhine primates endemic to the island of Madagascar.

fabric.title: SCENE 1: SELFIES
fabric.caption: Until shortly after humans arrived on the island around 2,000 years ago, there were lemurs as large as a male gorilla.

fabric.title: SCENE 1: SELFIES
fabric.caption: Until shortly after humans arrived on the island around 2,000 years ago, there were lemurs as large as a male gorilla.

fabric.title: SOCIAL EVENTS
fabric.caption: The word lemur derives from the word lemures (ghosts or spirits) from Roman mythology and was first used to describe a slender loris due to its nocturnal habits and slow pace, but was later applied to the primates on Madagascar.

fabric.title: SCENE 3: TAOBAO
fabric.caption: As with other strepsirrhine primates, such as lorises, pottos, and galagos (bush babies), lemurs share resemblance with basal primates. In this regard, lemurs are often confused with ancestral primates, when in actuality, lemurs did not give rise to monkeys and apes, but evolved independently.

fabric.title: SCENE 3: TAOBAO
fabric.caption: Due to Madagascar's highly seasonal climate, lemur evolution has produced a level of species diversity rivaling that of any other primate group.

fabric.title: SCENE 4: FAN IMITATIONS
fabric.caption: Until shortly after humans arrived on the island around 2,000 years ago, there were lemurs as large as a male gorilla.
